Description: The Specimen resource returns information about specimens used in diagnostic testing. Specimens can be defined in Epic or on orders from outside Epic directly, as is the case for specimens recorded in a third-party lab system.

accessionIdentifier.Name: accessionIdentifier
accessionIdentifier.Description: The lab ID of the specimen.

bodySite.Name: bodySite
bodySite.Description: The codes describing the anatomical collection site from which the specimen was collected (for example, a lung). For organizations in the Netherlands, this element can also include laterality. Available starting in November 2021 version of Epic.

bodySite.laterality.Name: extension
bodySite.laterality.Description: The laterality related to the anatomical collection site in the bodySite element (for example, indicating which lung a specimen was collected from). Available only for organizations in the Netherlands starting in November 2021 version of Epic.

collectedDateTime.Name: collectedDateTime
collectedDateTime.Description: Instant derived from the date and time of collection. When there is no date, this item returns null.

collector.Name: collector
collector.Description: Who collected the specimen. Reference to a Practitioner resource.

method.Name: method
method.Description: The method used to collect the specimen (for example, venipuncture). Available starting in November 2021 version of Epic.

quantity.Name: quantity
quantity.Description: Total collection volume. Available starting in November 2021 version of Epic.

receivedTime.Name: receivedTime
receivedTime.Description: The time when the specimen was received for processing. Available starting in November 2021 version of Epic.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Where the specimen information came from. Reference to the Patient resource. Available starting in November 2021 version of Epic.

type.Name: type
type.Description: Kind of material that forms the specimen.
